channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9182] Allow non-admin users to list all table names
item.description: HBASE-8692, prevents users retrieving table descriptors they don't have admin access to. As a side-effect it also prevents non-admin users from being able to list tables in the CLI. One proposal to fix this is to provide an API in HMaster which returns a list of table names only.
item.summary: Allow non-admin users to list all table names

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
One proposal to fix this is to provide an API in HMaster which returns a list of table names only.

+1 - Shall I work something up?
Assigning to myself. Shout if you want it done different than what Francis mentions.
0.94 version, working on trunk.

Trunk version.

List table names as a distinct operation from list table descriptors, both old style and by namespace.

Generated files for MasterAdminProtos and MasterMonitorProtos are not checked in?

Updated patches.

Trunk version adds shell support (oops). On trunk the shell includes an optional regex parameter.

Update getTableNames (and admin.rb) in the 0.94 version to support an optional regex also.

lgtm

Francis Liu What you think?

We can potentially remove getTableDescriptorsByNamespace api since we can get the descriptors with a second RPC call. If there's a concern about having too many apis.

list_namespace_tables cli command needs to be updated to use the new api.

+   */

+  public String[] getTableNamesByNamespace(final String name) throws IOException {

+    return

+        executeCallable(new MasterAdminCallable<String[]>(getConnection()) {

+

Should return TableName and use "list" instead of "get" to be consistent with the other new apis?

We can potentially remove getTableDescriptorsByNamespace api since we can get the descriptors with a second RPC call. If there's a concern about having too many apis.

Sounds good to me.


+ public String[] getTableNamesByNamespace(final String name) throws IOException {

Should return TableName and use "list" instead of "get" to be consistent with the other new apis?

So just drop the fooByNamespace additions?
Missed this: "list_namespace_tables cli command needs to be updated to use the new api". Can answer my own question. Updated patch shortly.
Updated patch for trunk addressing Francis' review comments.

Shouldn't this be "list" and not "get"

  • return @admin.getTableDescriptorsByNamespace(namespace_name).map { |t| t.getTableName().getNameAsString }

    + return @admin.getTableNamesByNamespace(namespace_name).map

    { |t| t.getQualifierAsString() }

aside from that lgtm.

Shouldn't this be "list" and not "get"


-        return @admin.getTableDescriptorsByNamespace(namespace_name).map { |t| t.getTableName().getNameAsString }

+        return @admin.getTableNamesByNamespace(namespace_name).map { |t| t.getQualifierAsString() }

Yes. Missed the shell update. Attached updated patch.
lgtm
Ok, will commit today to trunk and 0.95 unless objection.
Skimmed the patch. lgtm.

Committed to trunk and 0.95.

Going to commit the 0.94 patch shortly. Ping Lars Hofhansl

This does not exist in trunk:

2 - @admin.listTables(regex).map

{ |t| t.getTableName().getNameAsString }

nvm it does exist. TestShell is opaque about why it is failing.
Could be changed to listTableNames though as part of an addendum to fix TestShell. I was able to list test tables when testing manually and list_namespace_tables 'default' was fine too.
You have an addendum then Andrew Purtell? This TestShell is totally opaque

You have an addendum then Andrew Purtell? This TestShell is totally opaque

Working on it. Not sure what the problem is either right now.

Here is what I run:

MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx3g" mvn clean test -Dtest=TestShell

With -Dtest.output.tofile=false I see this:

1) Error:
test_list_should_not_return_meta_tables(Hbase::AdminMethodsTest):

I think the test needs updating, or admin.rb, the return type of the list table names API is an array not a list. My JRuby is weak. Working on it.

• admin_test.rb wants an Enumerable
  • Change getTableNames to return only userspace table names

Andrew Purtell Thanks boss for fixing it.

On the patch, it fixes the failing script.

Let me apply so builds start passing again.

Regards the below, is it ok if system tables are included in the returned list?

What about this bit Andrew:

+ if (descriptor.isMetaTable())

{ + continue; + }
Committed trunk addendum to 0.95 and trunk.

What about this bit Andrew:


+ if (descriptor.isMetaTable()) {

+ continue;

+ }

TableDescriptors is different on trunk, it will return system tables. I had the listTables API returning whatever TableDescriptors does. admin_test.rb has a check that 'hbase:meta' is not returned, so I changed listTables to conform.
Thanks

  • /hbase/trunk/hbase-server/src/main/ruby/hbase/admin.rb

I just noticed that this break backward compatibility in 0.94.
Here's what I see in a new (0.94.12) client connecting to an old (0.94.7) cluster:


ERROR: org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException: java.io.IOException: java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HMasterInterface.getTableNames()

	at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:1624)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.SecureRpcEngine$Server.call(SecureRpcEngine.java:293)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HBaseServer$Handler.run(HBaseServer.java:1426)

I'd suggest we roll this back from 0.94, and open a new jira for a backward compatible backport. You OK with that Andrew Purtell?
This is doing a "list" in the HBase shell.
We could only undo the change in admin.rb, or invent a new method there.
Going to revert from 0.94 for now.
I would recommend an issue to fix the problem rather than a revert. The revert just makes more work.
Fair enough. Filed HBASE-9448 as blocker for 0.94.12.
Hey Lars Hofhansl, Francis et al wanted this in 0.94 primarily. Reverting undoes stuff people need. It would be better IMHO to fix the shell to fall back if the new method isn't available.
We missed each other - ok, will fix HBASE-9448 today.
Thanks Andy.
